[h1] Dead by Daylight REVIEW[UPDATED] [/h1]

[b] When I wrote this review I spent 13.8 hours in this game. Next, you'll see why I recommend or don't recommend this game. [/b]

[h1] What do I like about the game? [/h1]

[b] -Nice design. [/b]
[b] -Maps are very good. [/b]
[b] -The characters are ok(Killers and Survivors[Jane Romero is pornstar? :D]). [/b]
[b] -The rank and level system is very nice. [/b]

[h1] What I don't like about the game? [/h1]

[b] -If I want to play as a killer, I have to wait enormously for a lobby. [/b]
[b] -I have a problem with rank... Every time[not really] i finish a match I'm disconnected from servers, why? [/b]
[b] -Ok so I'm in the lobby, 4 survivors are in the lobby, match starts, when the game is loading a player is disconnecting and I need to wait another 10-20 minutes to enter in a lobby. [/b]

[h1] I recommend this game? [/h1]

[spoiler] YES [/spoiler]

[h1] Will I still play this game? [/h1]

[spoiler] YES [/spoiler]

[h1] Is it worth the money? [/h1]

[spoiler] YES [/spoiler]

[quote=Tavi] Dead by Daylight [/quote]
I think we did a pretty good job so far

Dead by Daylight ist manchmal echt ein anstrengendes Spiel. Vorallem, wenn man gegen Camper, Tunneler, Abfarmer usw. spielt. Allerdings macht DBD auch echt laune. Wenn man in einer Runde alle gekillt hat, obwohl die Chancen quasi 0 waren, ist das doch echt befriedigend! Es wird auch immer neuer Content hinzugefügt, die Entwickler hören (meistens) auf die Fans, fügen gewünschte Sachen hinzu und balancen das Spielerlebnis für beide Seiten.
Super Spiel, hab den Einkauf vor fast 3 Jahren nicht bereut!
Quite nice and scary. I wish there would be more mods. It tends to become boring  after a while.

idk man id say this game is pretty hype i guess

Aun con sus defectos, es un juego muy divertido y disfrutable...

Edit: A día de hoy, no puedo recomendar el juego a nadie. El gen rush está a la orden del día si jugáis de Killer, sobre todo en rangos altos, donde priman comportamientos tóxicos sobre todo. La hitbox está totalmente estropeada a causa de los servidores dedicados y eso perjudica tanto a supervivientes como a asesinos, habiendo hasta teletransportes absurdos cuando el killer tira al suelo a un surv. Por supuesto, la conexión es nefasta, los killers tienen totalmente las de perder en una partida, sobre todo a la hora de enfrentarse a una premade, con casos como la reparación de los 5 generadores en menos de 5 minutos por chivarse hacia dónde va el killer y esconderse...ah, y el sistema de reportes no da ninguna garantía de que este vaya a algún lugar. Son demasiados fallos para lo que podría ser un grandísimo juego...definitivamente la comunidad de DbD se ha vuelto aún más tóxica que la de League of Legends...y eso es mucho decir.

Edit 2021: Para nada recomendable...DbD está condenado a muerte...volví a jugar tras un año que lo dejé...el gen rush se ha elevado al nivel de encontrar partidas terminadas en 5 minutos (1 por gen). El nuevo sistema de Matchmaking más "justo" se implantó ayer...pues bien, varias partidas y muchos survs iridiscentes vs un Bronce I...juzgad vosotros...

I’ve been playing this game for many years now. Both killer and survivor, both on red ranks. 
I like the game, but i also hate it at the same time. Mainly due to 3 issues:

1.	The community is super salty and will try to bully you if you let them. Especially when playing killer. It doesn’t matter whether you „win“ or „lose“, you’ll always find people hating you. 
You ain’t save as survivor either (they like to blame you, even if you did nothing wrong) 
Conclusion: Close the endgame-chat and set your steam profile comments on private!

2.	An unessecary mmr system nobody wanted, which also resulted in a broken matchmaking system
Conclusion: Always expect to play against high rank players. Doesn’t matter what rank you’re on. Whether it works that day or not is based on pure luck. 

3.	The real issue which is caused by the community as well as the devs: The game being unbalanced

Sure, a 4v1 can never be „fair“. Since the unwanted mmr system was introduced to the game, the devs changed their view on the killers performance. 2 kills (at any mean. It doesn’t matter how many people you’ve hooked) now is considered good performance. Anything above is "overperforming". 
The current balances therefore result in you, as the killer at top mmr, not to be allowed to do a single mistake, yet you still rely on the survivor to make a mistake. Meanwhile as the survivor, after making a mistake you get multiple second chances to get away. Sounds fair right?

If killers generally start „overperforming“ too much, they just get nerfed again, doesn’t matter how many statistics show that the killer is actually absolutely underperforming at high ranks. The best example is Wraith: A killer who has the ability to cloak himself and sneak up on survivors. Nothing too special about him. If you play smart, you may’d be able to catch them by surprise and down them with your sprint burst, before they can reach windows or drop pallets. A killer who was still very weak at high rank. Some players seemed to not like him, rage quitted or just let themselves die ingame, and called him out as op, so he got nerfed.

The same thing happened before to those killers that were actually viable at high ranks and would even get a 4k (good, but still normal performance before mmr was brought into the game) without having to sweat too much throughout the game. Those are the only killers that are actually fun to play against, because they’re not just simple killers you can loop around the same pallet for ages. They required a bit of a strategy to go against.
Hillbilly, Spirit and the Nurse were the most hated killers among most survivor mains. It was never easy going against these, but that’s exactly what made the game thrilling. Yet those players stuck on mid-ranks who got carried by their high-rank friends didn’t care. Instead of trying to learn how to play against them, they‘d just give up and report the killer as being too op. They often quit the game as soon as they‘d see which killer they were playing against! Screwing over the rest of their team, resulting in a different match result, which gives the devs false information.

They keep forgetting that it was actually quite hard to learn how to play the killers and i still wonder: Wouldn’t it make sense to actually get rewarded for your skill? Considering 2 kills at any means as more than enough shows that the devs don’t expect/want you to win (3-4 kills).

The devs only listen to survivors, never even trying to understand the point of view of killer mains and those who play both sides. They’re even ignoring streamers who’ve been playing this game since it launched (Example: TrueTalent). Yet they don’t understand that by pushing the killers to their limit, they’d force them to play even more unfair and resulting in everyone playing this game being unhappy and unecessarily stressed out.

After the big nerfs, there was only 1 more killer being released who had a good chance at high rank. The Blight. Who was quickly hated again by most survivor at mid-lower ranks. 
The dev who created this killer was actually the only one who seemed to care about killer players. What I think is quite funny is that when he left the team (for some reason) Blight got bugged. His power is to basically run at things and turn him into a living ping-pong, gaining a lot of speed doing so, catching most people before they can get behind cover.
 As soon as the dev left he started sliding off straight walls and most objects. Maps like the swamp are unusable for him. There were no updates that’d change anything about him. This bug had never ever existed before in the game, not even when he was still on the public test server. NEVER. After more than a year this bug still is in the game, preventing Blight from using his full potential.  The devs never attempted to fix it. We assume it was more of a shadow nerf to not upset us. 

Conclusion: The game is ruled by those who will destroy it, while the devs just wave goodbye at players with thousands of hours, ignoring their demands and warnings. 

Don’t buy this game till they decide to make a big change, unless you enjoy suffering. 

Please remind me if i forgot something in here. I tried to keep it short.
